## entries() function

Type-safe wrapper around `Object.entries()` that enhances TypeScript's type inference.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare function entries<const T extends object>(source: T): ObjectEntry<T>[];
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

source


</td><td>

T


</td><td>

The object to extract entries from


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
**Returns:**

[ObjectEntry](./type-object.objectentry.md)<!-- -->&lt;T&gt;\[\]

Array of typed \[key, value\] tuples

## Example


```ts
const obj = { a: 1, b: "hello" };
const result = entries(obj); // [["a", number], ["b", string]]

// Works with arrays too
const arr = [1, 2, 3];
entries(arr); // [[0, number], [1, number], [2, number]]
```
